programme.title: Cook Like An Italian
programme.desc: Silvia starts with the basics. How do Italian home cooks shop for pantry staples and fresh produce? A guided visit to an Italian deli leads to shopping and preparing of: a rustic Tuscan chickpea pasta, bakes 2 succulent and savoury Schiacciata breads and Silvia's mothers Apple and Mascarpone cake. Proving that when an Italian pantry is well stocked you only need a few fresh ingredients to create simple yet memorable meals

programme.title: Cook Like An Italian
programme.desc: Family recipes are an eternal source of happiness for Italians, and in this episode Silvia shares her family’s - most cherished meals. A rich sausage stew on a bed of soft polenta. A timeless family favourite, Pasta with Potato and - Provola. And direct from Italy via webcam, Silvia’ Mum helps her bake Abruzzese style waffles.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Join Ainsley in the kitchen, as he is inspired by winter warming dishes. The nights are getting longer, and so we seek for those comfort dishes to keep us warm and toasty! Ainsley starts with a hearty Beef & Red Pea Stew with Thyme Spinner Dumplings. He is joined in the kitchen by Strictly Come Dancing royalty—Anton Du Beke, who bakes up a big bowl of hugs, with his Rum & Raisin Bread & Butter Pudding. - Jeremy Pang is in his kitchen sharing his Lamb Rendang recipe. And Ainsley keeps us toasty and warm with his warm Mulled Cider, served with his Sweet & Spicy Nuts, followed by a delicious Tropical Rum Crumble & Nutmeg Custard.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Today’s Come Dine With Me: The Professionals is in the North East and kicking off the competition is Darlington based Indian and Bangladeshi restaurant, Babul’s, owned by brothers Zak and Shuhel, who are confident their modern twist on traditional Indian cooking will win over their fellow professionals

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: An unorthodox pairing of mole and scallops has the Wall paying attention in the Crowd-Pleaser round, and the home cooks don’t know which way the feta will crumble when they’re asked to cook from Chef Christine Cushing’s Mediterranean fridge.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: The chefs question whether ketchup can make a crowd-pleasing Pad Thai, and it’s all frowns when the home cooks are asked to use one of Chef Danny Smile’s favourite fridge ingredients, peperoncini.

programme.title: The Toque 12
programme.desc: Lai Po Heen is inspired by the great ancestral homes of 19th Century Chinese tycoons which is - appropriate given the restaurants current clientele. The Gulai House cuisine at the Datai in Langkawi - is inspired by the requirements of the islands past royalty.

programme.title: The Toque 12
programme.desc: Chef Phillip joins old friend, Ryan Clift, chef-owner of the Tippling Club, number 23 on the San - Pellegrino Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants List and known for it’s modern gastronomy and specialty cocktails.

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson demonstrates the versatility of toffee. She uses the fundamentals of toffee to create three fabulous sweet treats.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Lentils are a popular Saskatchewan crop that's often shipped overseas. A farmer, a brewer and a chef are changing that

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Middlesbrough, steak and seafood restaurant Lost Property kick start the competition with head chef Joe and manager Maria whipping up some serious surf and turf sharing boards.

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.desc: Anna and Kristina test their first non-paper cookbook and dive into the digital world by testing Jamie Oliver's popular application, “20 Minute Meals.”

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: Karena and Kasey travel across the Hawaiian Islands discovering what makes authentic Hawaiian food. They’re inspired to create their own luau feast for a group of locals, and find plenty of similarities between Hawaii and home.

programme.title: The Food Files
programme.desc: What is it in chocolate that makes it so desirable. Is chocolate really that bad for us?

programme.title: The Food Files
programme.desc: We love scrambled, poached, fried and hard-boiled eggs but are we getting too much of a good thing?

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson explores the fundamentals of pudding. She then makes three different styles of pudding, including individual pudding tarts.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Traditional foods that can be foraged or hunted have provided nourishment for the people on this land for thousands of years. Jenn learns about some of these ingredients and their uses

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Today’s Come Dine With Me Professionals heads to Devon and first up are Stepmum and Stepson Zoe and Don from Honky Tonk who offer up their unique brand of wine and dine

programme.title: Asia Unplated
programme.desc: The celebration of Cantonese cooking begins in one of Melbourne’s most iconic restaurants, Flower Drum, in the heart of Chinatown. MasterChef alumni and friend, Karlie Verkerk, shares her recipe Yum Cha favourite dessert, ‘Mango Pudding’. For the main course, Diana creates ‘Pak Cham Kai’ by poaching a whole chicken in a pot with aromatics and topping with infused oil – Cantonese home cooking, simple yet delicious.
